alert.note: Alert for Bartow; Cherokee; Cobb; Douglas; North Fulton; Paulding; South Fulton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Paulding, Cherokee, Cobb, northeastern Douglas, central Fulton and eastern Bartow Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 414 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from Funkhouser to Hobgood Park to Chapel Hill, and moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, pea sized hail and frequent cloud to ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Atlanta, Marietta, Douglasville, Canton, Cartersville, Mountain Park, City of South Fulton, Sandy Springs, Roswell, Alpharetta, Smyrna, East Point, Kennesaw, Woodstock, Acworth, Powder Springs, Holly Springs, Austell, Hiram, and Emerson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for north central and northwestern Georgia.
